thread.title: 19 Khwarij killed in 3 separate engagements in KPK, ISPR
thread.title_full: 19 Khwarij killed in 3 separate engagements in KPK, ISPR

author: Yumna Asif
title: 19 Khwarij killed in 3 separate engagements in KPK, ISPR
text:
19 Khwarij killed in 3 separate engagements in KPK, ISPR
Rawalpindi: Security forces conducted three separate intelligence-based operations in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa on September 9 and 10, eliminating a total of 19 foreign terrorists, according to the Inter-Services Public Relations (ISPR).
The operations were aimed at eradicating anti-state elements and ensuring the safety and security of the civilian population.
According to t ISPR, the first major operation took place in the Guluno area of District Mohmand, where intense exchange of fire occurred between the security forces and the terrorists. As a result, 14 foreign terrorists were neutralized.
The second operation was carried out in the Datta Khel area of North Waziristan, where four more terrorists were killed. The third operation took place in District Bannu, where one terrorist was eliminated during an exchange of fire, told ISPR
According to ISPR, a large cache of weapons and ammunition was recovered from the terrorists’ possession during these operations.
Following the engagements, sanitization of the areas is underway to eliminate any remaining threats and ensure the environment is secure.
ISPR emphasized that Pakistan’s security forces remain fully committed to rooting out terrorism, particularly the kind backed by Indian-sponsored networks. These operations are a clear demonstration of the military’s resolve to deal with all hostile elements threatening the peace and stability of the country.
On the other side PM Shehbaz pays tribute to security forces for successful operations in Mohmand, North Waziristan, and Bannu
Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif has paid tribute to the security forces for their recent successful operations against terrorists in Mohmand, North Waziristan, and Bannu. In these operations, 19 terrorists were killed, and the Prime Minister praised the professionalism and bravery of the forces involved.
The Prime Minister stated that the Pakistan Army and other security agencies are fully committed to eradicating terrorism and are actively engaged in thwarting the nefarious designs of the enemies. He emphasized that the entire nation stands shoulder to shoulder with the armed forces with unwavering resolve in the defense of the homeland.
He reaffirmed that the war against terrorism will continue until complete peace and stability are restored in Pakistan, and that the enemies of the country will never be allowed to succeed.
